top_categories.workout_context: Little Sugar MTB’s bentonville mtb trails (70% singletrack), gravel/dirt roads (30%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Little Sugar MTB isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Little Sugar MTB’s bentonville mtb trails—technical ozarks singletrack and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Little Sugar MTB — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Little Sugar MTB — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on bentonville mtb trails—technical ozarks singletrack.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Little Sugar MTB count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Little Sugar MTB rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Little Sugar MTB when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Little Sugar MTB’s bentonville mtb trails—technical ozarks singletrack drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The varied gradients at Little Sugar MTB reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Little Sugar MTB. Make this intensity feel like home.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Little Sugar MTB’s bentonville mtb trails—technical ozarks singletrack delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Standard hydration and fueling. One bottle per hour minimum. Gel or bar every 45 minutes at race intensity.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Little Sugar MTB demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride bentonville mtb trails—technical ozarks singletrack at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: bentonville mtb trails (70% singletrack), gravel/dirt roads (30%), technical ozarks terrain. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 30 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 30 miles of bentonville mtb trails—technical ozarks singletrack in Bentonville, Arkansas.
